intro: Cyclosorus obtusifolius, commonly known as the blunt-leaved cyclosorus, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically rounded or heart-shaped with a broad base. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in ponds and marshes. Its reproductive structures include small, spore-bearing sorus clusters on the underside of its leaves. Cyclosorus obtusifolius plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
